summary: This document is a detailed timeline of events leading up to and following the death of Jeffrey Epstein in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. It records his activities on August 9, 2019, the discovery of his unresponsive body on the morning of August 10, the medical response, official notifications, and the transfer of his body to the medical examiner.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose death is the subject of the timeline. He was found unresponsive in his cell on the morning of August 10, 2019, and was later pronounced dead at the hospital.

persons.name: Reyes Efrain
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who departed for court on the morning of August 9, 2019, and did not return to the institution that day.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: The judge overseeing Epstein's case who was notified of his death at 10:00 am on August 10, 2019, and later provided with the press release.

persons.name: Warden
persons.context: Arrived at the institution at 7:30 am on August 10, 2019, following the medical emergency.

persons.name: SIS Lt
persons.context: Notified of the incident, arrived at the institution, and reported to the SHU to conduct interviews with inmates on the tier.

persons.name: CMC
persons.context: Notified of the incident, arrived at the institution, traveled to the hospital to secure Epstein's fingerprints, photographs, and clothing, and notified Epstein's brother (next of kin).

persons.name: IDO
persons.context: Reported providing Epstein a social call on the evening of August 9 where he was in 'good spirits,' and later accompanied the CMC to the hospital.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: Arrived at the institution at 8:00 am on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: SCSS
persons.context: Notified of the incident and arrived at the institution on the morning of August 10, 2019.

persons.name: ER Physician
persons.context: Reported the official time of death as 7:20 am on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Edge
persons.context: Notified along with the AW at 7:30 am on August 10, 2019.

connections.description: Reyes Efrain was Epstein's cellmate in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) prior to departing for court on August 9, 2019.
Judge Berman was the presiding judge in Epstein's case and was officially notified of his death.
The Case Management Coordinator was responsible for notifying Epstein's next of kin and securing his personal effects from the hospital.
The Institution Duty Officer reported having a social call with Epstein on the evening before his death, noting he was in 'good spirits.'

events.title: Epstein's Last Full Day
events.description: Epstein spends the day in attorney conferences. In the evening, the IDO reports he is in 'good spirits' during a social call. His cellmate, Reyes Efrain, departs for court and does not return.

events.title: Discovery of Unresponsive Epstein
events.description: At 6:33 am, a body alarm is activated in the SHU. Staff find Epstein unresponsive in his cell. CPR is initiated immediately.

events.title: Medical Response and Transport
events.description: Medical staff and EMS continue CPR, apply an AED, intubate Epstein, and administer epinephrine. He is transported to Beekman Hospital at 7:10 am.

events.title: Official Time of Death
events.description: An ER physician reports the official time of death as 7:20 am. Multiple officials, including the Warden, FBI, AUSA, and Judge Berman, are notified.

events.title: Official Notifications and Investigation Initiated
events.description: Epstein's brother (next of kin) is notified. A press release is issued. The body is released to the Medical Examiner for autopsy. The OIG and FBI arrive to investigate.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) / The Institution (implied location of SHU)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at 6:33 am on Saturday, August 10, 2019.
On the previous evening (August 9), an Institution Duty Officer (IDO) reported Epstein was in 'good spirits' during a social call.
Epstein's cellmate, Reyes Efrain, had departed for court on the morning of August 9 and did not return to the institution, leaving Epstein alone in the cell.
The official time of death was reported by an ER physician as 7:20 am on August 10, after extensive resuscitation efforts failed.
Multiple external agencies, including the FBI and the Office of the Inspector General (OIG), were notified and arrived on-site to investigate the incident.
